eng: You need to study more.

eng: We felt the house shake a little.

eng: I went to bed later than usual.

eng: When did Tom buy these eggs?

eng: I hope that you won't make the same mistake as Tom.

eng: "Have you seen my cell phone?" "It's on the table."

We haven't received any help from anyone.
Tom complained that he couldn't find a job.

eng: The best way to learn a foreign language is to go live in a country where it's spoken.

eng: You are the only one who can save the world.
ara: أنت الواحد والوحيد الذي يستطيع إنقاذ العالم.

eng: What do you like about her?

eng: If Tom finds out I told you this, he'll kill me.

eng: Nobody listened to me.

eng: The murder remains a mystery.

eng: I can't forget the day when I met him.

eng: Everything I did, I did for Tom.

Does this come in any other color?

eng: I'm trying my best to forget that ever happened.

eng: We don't have enough money to buy everything we need.

eng: I'm sorry that I can't meet you tonight.

eng: I haven't paid for the tickets yet.

eng: The railroad workers are going on strike tomorrow.
ara: عمال السكك الحديدية سيضربون عن العمل غداً.

eng: She always forgets my telephone number.

eng: I remember seeing her once on the street.

eng: They were not invited.

eng: We're sorry but this video is no longer available.

eng: You shouldn't have come here.

This isn't a time for celebration.

eng: I'm likely to forget to do that.

Tom didn't know how to express his thanks in French.
ara: توم لم يكن يعلم كيفية الشكر بالفرنسية.

eng: I think I mistakenly sent that email to Tom.

eng: What a terrible mistake!
I love trying new things.

eng: I remember hearing a very similar story to that.

eng: The hard work begins now.

eng: You can't do two things at once.

eng: If it's possible, I'd like to exchange this for a larger size.

eng: What do I have to do now that I'm registered?

eng: They fell one after another.

eng: I'll stay there till six o'clock.

eng: If it rains tomorrow, will you stay at home?

eng: I don't blame you.

Let's not watch TV.

eng: Tom knows he can do it.

ara: هل أنت ماهر في لعب التنس؟

eng: There are a few apples on the tree, aren't there?
ara: هناك القليل من التفاح على الشجرة ، أليس كذلك؟

eng: I remember seeing her once on the street.

eng: This is the key that opens that door.

eng: Maybe you should turn off the television and do something else.

eng: After a while, the man came into the room.

eng: May I ask some questions?

eng: Do you know anyone in Australia?

eng: Are you sure that Tom wasn't the one who did that?

eng: I was happy for him.

eng: Watch the rear. I'll watch the front.

eng: When I opened the door of the refrigerator, an apple fell out.

eng: Their friendship moved us deeply.

eng: He just wants to have fun.
ara: إنه يريد فقط الحصول على المتعة.

eng: Is Tom really going to Boston by himself?
ara: أحقّا سيذهب توم إلى بوسطن لوحده؟

eng: Madrid is the capital of Spain.
Can I take a break now?
ara: أيمكنني أخذ قسط من الراحة الآن؟

eng: Tom said that his life was in danger.
ara: قال توم إن حياته كانت في خطر.

eng: You can ask him for help.
ara: يمكنك أن تطلب منه أن يساعدك.

eng: May I ask you something?
ara: هل لي أن أطلب منك شيئا؟

eng: No one believed his story.
The hijackers moved to the rear of the plane.
ara: تحركوا خاطفو الطائرة الى مؤخرة الطائرة .

eng: Tom's house was built in 2013.
She spent the weekend by herself.
Take this chair. It's sturdy.
I will never forget this.
My dream is to become a teacher.
There must be a better way to do this.
ara: لا بدّ أنّ هناك طريقة أفضل لفعل هذا.

eng: She's way taller than me.
ara: الفرق بيني و بينها في الطول كبير.

eng: I like playing sports.
He likes to sing in the bathtub.
ara: يعجبه أن يغني في حوض الاستحمام.

eng: Doubt everything and everyone.
ara: شك في كل شيء وكل شخص.

eng: I don't consider Tom a friend.
I'm not going to school on Saturday.
You're in better shape than I am.
ara: أنت في حالة أفضل مما أنا عليه.

eng: Why were you late this morning?
Tom seems to be very popular.
What should I do?
I don't remember what happened anymore.
He works at a bank.
I don't care what your mother said.
I'm very sensitive to cold. May I have another blanket?
ara: انا حساس جدا من البرد. ممكن اعطائي بطانية أخرى

eng: I don't want to look like a tourist.
I would like to ask a question.
"Will it rain tomorrow?" "I hope not."
ara: هل ستمطر غدا؟ لا أتمني ذلك

eng: There are no hospitals in the vicinity of his house.
Doing that would be dangerous.
Your daughters have turned into women.
They don't even know why.
I met Tom in the library on Monday.
ara: قابلت توم في المكتبة يوم الاثنين.

eng: Tom is the only one who can do this.
ara: توم هو فقط من يمكنه فعل هذا.

eng: Mom, Tom's hitting me!
I don't want to hear another word about it!
ara: لا أُريد أن أسمع كلمة أُخرىَ عن هذا!

eng: Could I have a glass of white wine?
ara: هل أستطيع الحصول على كأس من النبيذ الأبيض؟

eng: They are demanding shorter working hours.
I'm going to help you save some time.
I've heard this song before.
ara: لقد سمعت هذه الأغنية من قبل.

eng: Who owns this house?
Are you older than Tom?
Tom is waiting to talk to you.
Ostriches can't fly.
I knew that it was you.
Was it an earthquake?
My sister saw it with her own eyes.
She ate only lean meat.
I'm going there even if you don't go.
ara: انا ذاهب الى هناك حتى ولو لم تذهب

eng: If you want to dance, let's dance together.
ara: إذا اردت أن ترقُص, هيا نرقص معاً.

eng: Water has zero calories.
Your house is three times as large as mine.
ara: بيتك أكبر من بيتي ثلاث مرات.

eng: Though I was tired, I did my best.
ara: مع أني كنت متعبا إلا أني قدمت أفضل ما عندي.

eng: How many days do you usually need to get there?
ara: كم يوماً تحتاج عادةً للوصول إلى هناك؟

eng: Can you find it?
The station is not far from here.
Tom wanted to call the police, but Mary wouldn't let him.
ara: أراد توم استدعاء الشرطة، ولكن ماري لم تسمح له.

eng: My older brother borrowed money from a loan shark.
ara: اقترض أخي الأكبر مالاً من مرابي

eng: This is the time he normally arrives.
ara: هذا هو الوقت الذي يصل فيه عادة.

eng: All of us should go.
He lost two sons in the war.
Don't you want to watch TV?
I'm tired. It's been a long day.
ara: أنا متعب. لقد كان يوماً طويلاً.

eng: Drivers should be aware of the traffic rules.
ara: على السائقين أن ينتبهوا لقواعد المرور.

eng: Get Tom some water.
I'm going to find a place of my own.
Where would you suggest we go?
I have something that I want to say to you.
There were twenty or so people there.
Tom has the ability to do that.
It seems right to me.
We have to put off making a final decision until next week.
ara: علينا أن نأجل القرار النهائي حتى الأسبوع القادم.

eng: Is this a picture that you yourself drew?
ara: هل هذه صورة أنتِ رسمتِها بنفسك؟

eng: It was very kind of you to lend me an umbrella.
ara: كان من عظيم لطفك أن أعرتني مظلةً.

eng: She can speak French fluently.
This is the worst movie I have ever seen.
ara: هذا أسوأ فلم شاهدته في حياتي.

eng: People are living in all parts of the world.
ara: الناس يعيشون في جميع أنحاء العالم.

eng: Who do you want to talk to?
Your mother is in critical condition.
Falling in love is the most natural thing in the world.
ara: لا شيء طبيعي أكثر من الوقوع في الحب.

eng: How much for half a kilo?
My hair isn't as long as Tom's.
I've finally finished writing the report.
You talk as if you were the boss.
We must go there whether we like it or not.
ara: علينا الذهاب إلى هناك شئنا أم أبينا.

eng: A sane man wouldn't do that.
His daughter and my son are good friends.
The rioters beat many policemen to death.
ara: قام المتظاهرون بضرب العديد من رجال الشرطة حتى الموت.

eng: The Internet is very useful for knowing the circumstances of each part of the world.
ara: الإنترنت مفيد جدا لمعرفة ظروف كل جزء من العالم.

eng: I may be old, but I can still ride a bike.
ara: لربّما كنت كبير السن ولكنني لا زلت أستطيع ركوب الدراجة.

eng: It isn't as cold here as I expected.
ara: انها ليست باردة هنا كما توقعت.

eng: I'll fix you some coffee.
The problem is that solar energy costs too much.
ara: المشكلة أن الطاقة الشمسية تكلف كثيرا.

eng: The last person I told my idea to thought I was nuts.
ara: آخِرُ شخصٍ أخبرتُه فكرتي ظنّنِيْ مجنونًا.

eng: She gave him a slap in the face.
If you don't work, you can't eat.
ara: إن لم تعمل لن تستطيع الأكل.

eng: Tom announced he was retiring.
Is this a gift for me?
She always buys expensive clothes.
Tom knows I like him.
I'm not satisfied with what you've done.
Tom is going to boarding school next year.
ara: سيذهب توم إلى مدرسة داخلية في العام القادم.

eng: Is that pure gold?
Do you think this book is worth reading?
ara: هل تعتقد أن هذا الكتاب يستحق القراءة؟

eng: He was very thirsty and asked for some water.
ara: كان عطشاناً جداً فطلب القليل من الماء.

eng: I studied English when I was there.
She was mad at her son.
There are some books on the desk.
Come on! We'll be late.
She slapped his face.
It's impossible to tell for certain.
Where is the laundry?
ara: أين الملابس التي تحتاج إلى غسل؟

eng: I told them to send me another ticket.
ara: أخبرتُهُم أن يُرْسِلُوا لي تذِكرةً أُخرى.

eng: My life was in danger.
He went out in a hurry.
Children are often very good at learning foreign languages.
ara: عادة ما يكون الأطفال ماهرين جداً في تعلم اللغات.

eng: Do you know how to use a computer?
You're Tom's friend, aren't you?
ara: أنت صديق توم، أليس ذلك صحيحاً؟

eng: Wait till the rain stops.
ara: انتظر حتى يتوقف المطر عن الهطول.

eng: This book hasn't yet been translated into French.
ara: لم يُترجم هذا الكتاب إلى الفرنسية بعد.

eng: I don't know what to say.
The magazine comes out every week.
I think that Tom is hiding something.
I don't know whether she will come.
Do you eat in the classroom?
Do you like San Francisco?
Nearly a thousand people participated in the demonstration.
ara: شارك في المظاهرة ما يقارب ألف شخص.

eng: I hope everything goes OK.
ara: آمل أن يسير كل شيء على ما يرام

eng: A broken-down car was standing in the middle of the road.
ara: وقفت سيارة متعطلة في منتصف الطريق.

eng: Does Tom have doubts?
Tom became depressed after Mary left him.
ara: أصاب الإحباط توم بعدما تركته ماري.

eng: Stop teasing your brother!
Would you mind standing aside?
Please don't run in the classroom.
ara: من فضلك لا تركض في الصف.

eng: Everybody was very well dressed.
"But don't you think that it's a little big?" asked the shopkeeper.
ara: سألت صاحبة المحل: "ولكن، ألا تظنها كبيرة قليلًا؟".

eng: There are many words that I don't understand.
ara: ثمّة العديد من الكلمات التي لا أفهمها.

eng: The samples were collected from two hundred medical institutions all over the world.
ara: جُمِعت العيناتُ من مائتي مؤسسة طبية في جميع أنحاء العالم.

eng: The police officer fired a warning shot.
From the direction that he was going in, I would say he was headed to town.
ara: بناءً على الاتجاه الذي سار فيه، أظن أنه كان متجهًا إلى البلدة.

eng: Is the snake alive or dead?
I've never seen Tom dance.
Every house had a garden.
Look at the boy jump!
ara: أنظر إلى الولد و هو يقفز!

eng: This is never going to end.
My father bought a new car.
What do you actually do in the office?
ara: ما هي طبيعة عملك في المكتب؟

eng: I listen to the radio every night.
Are you busy tomorrow morning?
All roads lead to Rome.
He's come to make trouble.
Please clean the floor with this mop.
ara: من فضلك نظف الارض بهذه الممسحة

eng: I wonder why Tom said that.
